.. _`cs-tasks-comps`:

Public Components
===================================================================================================

.. warning::

    Only components documented in this chapter are considered public components. Some components
    exported/registered for external access only for configuring |cs.taskmanager|.

The components documented in this chapter are reusable in your own components. Their properties
are desribed below. Additionally, you can test them interactively using their storybooks:

- Start a web server with environment variable :envvar:``CADDOK_WEBUI_STORYBOOK`` set to ``True``,
- Open a web browser and navigate to ``/storybook``,
- Select a story of one of the components below to see it in action.

Table Cell Plugins
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

All table cells get the following React Properties, although they are not used in all cell
components:

Standard Table Cell React Properties
....................................

+----------------+---------------+------------------+--------------------------------------------+
| Property       | Type          | Default          | Use                                        |
+================+===============+==================+============================================+
| column         | Immutable.Map | \-               | The table column this cell represents.     |
+----------------+---------------+------------------+--------------------------------------------+
| row            | Immutable.Map | \-               | The table row this cell represents.        |
+----------------+---------------+------------------+--------------------------------------------+
| isGroup        | Boolean       | \-               | ``true`` if this is a column group header. |
+----------------+---------------+------------------+--------------------------------------------+

The following components can be used to render columns:

- :ref:`cs-taskmanager-web-table.cell_components.DateCell.__default__`
- :ref:`cs-taskmanager-web-table.cell_components.IconCell.__module__`
- :ref:`cs-taskmanager-web-table.cell_components.OverdueCell.__module__`
- :ref:`cs-taskmanager-web-table.cell_components.PrioCell.__module__`
- :ref:`cs-taskmanager-web-table.cell_components.ProceedCell.ProceedCell`
- :ref:`cs-taskmanager-web-table.cell_components.ReadStatusCell.ReadStatusCell`
- :ref:`cs-taskmanager-web-table.cell_components.StatusCell.__module__`
- :ref:`cs-taskmanager-web-table.cell_components.TagsCell.TagsCell`

Task Details Plugins
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

To quickly set up a simple description plugin for a new :ref:`cs-tasks-class`, you can leverage the
supplied template:

``webmake create custom.module.appname --templates cs.taskmanager:cs-tasks-desc``

You may use these components in your task details plugins:

- :ref:`cs-taskmanager-web-details.components.AttributeList.__module__`
- :ref:`cs-taskmanager-web-details.components.LongText.__module__`
- :ref:`cs-taskmanager-web-details.components.TaskContextTree.__module__`
- :ref:`cs-taskmanager-web-details.components.TaskReferenceList._TaskReferenceList`
